data.title: Victor Hugo (A Concise Biography)
data.meta_description: Films Media Group, an Infobase Learning Company, is the premier source of high-quality academic streaming video and DVDs for schools, colleges, and libraries.
data.text:
Victor Hugo's Beginnings (03:22)

FREE PREVIEW

This program provides an overview of the life and writings of Victor Hugo. The opening scene discusses Hugo's birth in Besançon in 1802. His father was a major in Napoleon's army and his mother a well-educated orphan, but their marriage deteriorated.

Hugo's Writing Talent Emerges (03:35)

Les Feuillantines features vividly in Victor Hugo's imagination. His father's military career skyrockets. Abel Hugo starts Le Conservateur Litteraire and Victor Hugo's writing ability astounds readers.

Two Loves of Hugo (03:45)

Felix Biscarrat and Francois de Neufchateau recognizes are patrons of Hugo. Abel Hugo arranges for the publication of Odes et poésies diverses in 1822. Hugo marries Adele Foucher and completes "Han d'Islande."

Major Success for Hugo (03:08)

Victor Hugo has a daughter Leopoldine. Hugo is made a Chevalier de la Légion d'Honneur and is Poet Laureate at Charles X's coronation. Hugo turns to theater writing producing Hernani and The Hunchback of Notre Dame.

Hugo's Love Affair (02:16)

Victor Hugo is a neighbor of Theophile Gautier. Adele Hugo's affair changes Victor's perception of marriage. He conducts an affair with Juiette Drouet for fifty years.

Tragedy Turns Hugo's Direction (03:41)

Victor Hugo addresses the Academe Fancaise. His daughter drowns at Villequier and he turns to Leonie Biard. in 1845, Hugo becomes a Peer of France. He begins to write Les Miserables.

Political Events in Hugo's Life (03:17)

Political events that affect Victor Hugo are the Revolutions of 1789 -1848-1870, the execution of King Louis XVI, Napoleon Bonaparte's rise and fall of power, and the crowning of Kings Charles X and Louis Phillipe.

Hugo's Political Stance (03:32)

Victor Hugo slowly moves to the representation of the people. He uses his influence to favor of the people. Commoners have difficulty understanding Hugo's position. The Hugo family first supports then criticizes Napoleon.

Exile is Purposeful for Hugo (04:03)

Victor Hugo finds himself in a compromising four-way love affair. Louis Napoleon puts a price on his head. Exile in England is an opportunity for Hugo. He produces Napoleon Le Petit and Les Châtiments

Tragedy Strikes Victor Hugo (03:23)

Victor Hugo moves to Guernsey. Maurice publishes "Contemplations" and Hugo finishes Les Miserables. In 1870, Hugo returns to Paris to save the city. His wife and son die and he leaves for Luxembourg.

Hugo's Life and Death (02:11)

Victor Hugo's political opinions hold little sway but his plays revive. Sarah Bernhardt acts in Ruy Blas. He returns to Guernsey and writes "Quatre-Vingt-Treize and L'Art d'être grand-père." Hugo dies in 1885, leaving a lasting legacy.

Credits: Victor Hugo: A Concise Biography (00:37)

Credits: Victor Hugo: A Concise Biography

An Overview of Victor Hugo's Work (09:47)

Political intrigue was a major part of Hugo's life. Hugo's work can be divided into four categories: prose pieces, poetry, drama, and novels. The Essence of Hugo can be found in Les Miserables and Notre Dame De Paris.
